title: SYRBOTAI
content:
THE SYRBOTAI (Syrbotae) were a tribe of twelve foot tall African men.

Pliny the Elder, Natural History 6. 194 (trans. Rackham) (Roman encyclopedia C1st
          A.D.) :
        "On the African side [of the Aethiopian kingdom of Meroe] are the Medimni, and then a Nomad tribe that
        lives on the milk of the dog-faced baboon [the Cyncophali], the Alabi, and the Syrbotae who are said to be 12
        feet high."

Pliny the Elder, Natural History 7. 31 :
        "Crates of Pergamenus [Greek writer C2nd B.C.] says that . . . there are Aethiopes (Ethiopians) more than
        twelve feet in height, and that this race is called the Syrbotae."

A complete bibliography of the translations quoted on this page.
